Text:
I was working as a secretary.  My boss was to go to give a  
lecture, and wanted me to give him the exact address of the  
place.
When I won my car.

I was ashamed when I got the lowest result (mark) in class. All  
the same I didn't worry too much because I knew I would have got  
much better if I had read enough.
After the fact that made me ashamed I felt sadness.

I felt guilty when I mislead a person into thinking he was a  
close friend when that person was more of a casual acquaintance.

Walking through campus at night a squirrel jumped in front of  
me.
I refused to lend my homework to a friend.
The dying of a close member of the family.

I had cared for a horse for 2 years. One day it was sold and I  
cried for several days because I was so sad.

While quarreling with my brother I broke the glass door of the  
cupboard and a china doll.  We were scolded by my father for  
breaking the door but we did not tell him about the door.
Said something I should not have said in public.

When I was in F4 I led my class to a riot.  However the form  
master said that my conduct was good and asked me to tell him the  
names of those who had taken part in it.   I replied that I did  
not know.

When you told everyone in the last lecture you will do all  
lectures again in English and everybody can come (not only  
English classes)
I received an assignment back, and got an A+ grading.
I took french leave to do my homework.

I had an argument with my mother because I criticized the rules  
she imposes at home, which are too rigid and arbitrary for me.

During a football match, the other team was rude and they hurt my  
team members and me.  The coach was prejudiced against us and  
punished us unreasonably.  Later we fought with each other and  
the match had to be cut short.

I once proposed my own niece whom I did not know but I discovered  
after she was my girlfriend.

When, for example, I was not approved to continue my studies at  
the Moscow University, no matter that I had the highest marks and  
in general the best records of all the candidates.
When I am at home alone.

When I was to sit for my first entrance exam. I had fear of a  
possible failure.

I hated you for not letting me go and found out that it was not  
your decision.

When I was victimized for running away with a girl who was  
somebody else's wife and niece at the same time.  I was very  
angry over this issue because I was told to pay him money after  
having been punished for it.
Lost my girl-friend.

When people are eating unsavoury (smacking, belching, speaking  
with food in their mouth, etc.).
When I left a man in whom I really believed.

When my demand for accomodation on the campus was refused and the  
rooms were allotted to first year students who were from "Rucher"  
and came from influential families.

I had a good relationship with two friends. Once without reason,  
they clearly showed that they thought I was naive, dull and  
unable to take care for myself, while I expostulated that I could  
manage things.

When the dean of UNZA asked me to vacate a big flat I was  
occupying and take up a smaller one as I was becoming a full time  
student at UNZA.
When I missed the tram after having run for it.
Being insulted on a bus.
At work being shifted to another area.

My boy-friend came home late one night without having told me  
about it before.

My mother had not come home at midnight.  She had forgotten to  
tell me about it.  I was very young and all alone at home.

When I cancelled an appointment with an idle story. Afterwards  
it appeared that the person had looked forward to it and reserved  
time for it.

During a movie in which I saw the effect of white settlers in  
Africa.

Having to go back home form the U.S. after having been there for  
ten weeks to visit my brother and his family.

After the first of May, I detested my fiance's friends, who had  
piled on to our party and spoilt it completely.
A break-up with someone I really liked.

I thought of myself as being clumsy when I made love for the  
first time with a girl.

Out of sheer curiosity, I went to see a pornographic movie in  
Copenhagen.  The room was full of men, who panted and  
masturbated.  Very disgusting.

After having quarelled unnecessarily and without any reason, and  
having been stupidly cross in every way.
When I realized that I loved someone of the opposite sex.

When I came across an old friend whom I had not seen for a very  
long time.
When I triffled with other people.

When I entered the wound intensive care at the Central Hospital  
in Blantyre which was stinking.
Dead rat in the kitchen of the university.

When I saw a good male friend unexpectedly after a year, as I've  
just returned from overseas. I was feeling tired, looking a mess,  
and nervous.

My parents appreciate very much me and my boyfriend coming and  
have dinner with them at Christmas. However we decided to visit  
his parents. My mother was rather disappointed.

I was having an argument with my brother on his behavior, then we   
started fighting and I got annoyed at him because he started  
teasing me.

On a dark night I felt that there were several people near me  
and I did not know who they were.
When my mother was proved to suffer from a very serious disease.

When I learnt that my brother-in-law had been poisoned by his  
friends and that he was dead.

I went to the dining hall and found that the cooks were cleaning  
the plates and there was no food for me, and the blue birds   
(security guards) were busy eating the food that was supposed to  
be for me.

When I miss the train and I am late, and I have to wait half an  
hour for the next one.
My roommate being unconsiderate.
Exchange of points of view with my sister on a family matter.

When my dad told me about something he had done against my  
mother.

When my boyfriend sat up half the night playing computer games  
with a friend.

When I saw a friend of mine, whom I had not seen for a long time  
and I had lost his address and telephone number.

It was in 1983 September when MCE results were being announced on  
the radio. When I heard my name that I had done well I just kept  
quiet. I was so happy that I couldn't even talk.

As a small boy, I took a coin from an empty taxi cab.  My mother  
saw it and told the driver about it.  I even knew the driver.

In our class we had a test on Nursing, so a friend from the Army  
was caught peeping, by using a paper which had already answers  
which was written by him. So all of us from the Army got ashamed.

It was during the beginning of the term. I had K100 and kept it  
in my handbag. I left the handbag in the wardrobe but didn't  
lock it. Next time I found that K30 were stolen.

I mangled the side of my dad's van on a fence. I did not realize  
the extent of the damage until he showed it to me the next day.  
The shock on my face was genuine so a friend interceded with a  
good excuse which I did not deny. I never clarified the  
situation.

When the person I'm having the affair with won't talk to me in  
public.

Our class had organized a picnic in November.  I was the class  
representative so I became the organizor.  However the picnic  
was postponed by one week and I had something else to do then.  
Initially I did not ponder on what to do and decided to go for  
the picnic.  When I had the time to think about it I thought that  
my decision was wrong.  My classmates thought that I would go as  
I had signed my name but I did not go.  I told another class  
representative that I was not going but he did not know the  
reason behind my not going.  After the picnic my classmates asked  
me why I had not gone to the picnic and everytime someone  
mentioned it I was apologetic.  I should have decided right in  
the begining that I would not go and then they would not see me  
as irresponsible i.e promising to go and changing my mind  
afterwards.
Having received an offer to do post-graduate work.

I spend the night with my boyfriend, while there was also a  
friend of his. We all lay on the floor to sleep. When my  
boyfriend was fallen asleep the other boy and I started petting.  
After 15 minutes I felt miserable and awoke my boyfriend to tell  
him that.

Recently when my sister, who is four years younger than me and  
very spoiled, shouted at my mother for no apparent reason .  The  
heart-broken expression on my mother's face made me feel very  
angry.

A friend of mine got encouragement and I did not, as the  
supervisor did not like me.

My father had an operation which lasted for hours.  We were all  
very worried but it was successful.
Being rude to someone I do not like.
A night spent with a group of friends.
When I could study at university.

I felt angry at one time when I was chatting with friends and  
suddenly another friend joined us and started opposing any  
comment I added to our chatting.

When my husband lied to me, tricked me and when I had to leave my  
home.
Doing unexpectedly well in an examn.

When my boyfriend and I went out for a dinner and subsequently  
went to his family. We had a very nice evening.

When I realized that I was in hospital after a car accident and  
that I had a scleral tear in my left eye.

I was angry when someone stole a magazine which I had borrowed  
from another friend and locked it in a drawer.

Joy for me is when all my family gather around home for special  
occasions as Christmas etc. It really gives me joy to see my  
family and relatives and to observe natures productivity process  
which have been going on for centuries.

When my father's new fiancee treats me like a child.  She does  
not trust me and constantly misunderstands me.  I get  
particularly angry when she says nasty things about my boyfriend  
with whom she works.

When I had wrongly explained someone an important exemple for an  
examination.

Going to a friend's wedding and seeing many of my old friends  
whom I had known before I moved to a new district five years  
previously.

Our tutorial group was soon to be divided, and we got a list of  
names of freshmen, out of which five were to be in my group.  We  
read the names and then each group went its own way to a seminar  
room.  I wondered how I would cope with the new situation and if  
I would succeed as a group leader.
When I got 1 mark in an Abnormal Psychology exam.

I was skiing with friends and they wanted to ski-jump. I did not  
want to be left behind, so I braced myself and followed them.

Some days ago I had a car accident. It was quite slight but  
through my fault. I felt strong shame because I had the spirits  
of a good driver.
When I failed the entrance exam to IMEC.

When my father did not get back from Chipata on time, he was thus  
holding back progress as everything depended on him.  I felt  
angry over his actions.

When I have to take exams I am very excited and have not much  
time for the housekeeping. Then my friend has to do everything.

When I was 6 or 7 years old, I pulled down the trousers of a  
friend because I wanted to know what she looked like. My mother  
watched that and (as a punishment) sent me into the house. We  
never spoke about that; I think it was as embarassing for her as  
it was for me.

The doctors from Belogradchik town determined a wrong diagnosis  
to my son. A month later, after some complex examinations at ISUL  
(A medical institute in Sofia), the diagnosis was categorically rejected.

There is a boy who I love very much. I asked him to have dinner  
with me, but he refused I don't know why he didn't go with me,  
but I felt very lonely.
To fight with a sister and to know that she doesn't care.

I felt sad when a thief stole all the clothes from my friend's  
cupboard at school (boarding).

About my girlfriend's sister who is a viper as I discovered some  
time ago.

I was almost caught in the girls hostel by the security men, I  
would have been expelled from school had I been caught.

When I "passed out" a female friend of mine for no apparent  
reason.  I was under the influence of drugs and when I am like  
that I get mad at anyone, however small the provocation.

I once failed a test miserably and my friend did very well and  
someone made a nasty comment while comparing me to my friend.
Left alone in the biology building surrounded by empty buildings.

When it was discovered that I had done the assignment at my work  
place, this caused a lot of embarrassment for me.

Recently when I made a slip and blurted out indecent words in my  
mother's presence.
My parents failed to visit me as they promised.
A sudden end to the relationship with my first girlfriend.

When a close friend of mine maintained a relationship with me  
till she needed me and broke it off when she did not need me.   
She behaved life a really selfish person.

I was once this week angry when soemone trying to compress my  
mind due to his nonsense speech which himself could not tolerate  
at all.
When I was insulted by a fellow student.

[ I had, by being silent, disapproved my love and made him  
unhappy.  He had not been able to keep his promise.  I thus was  
thinking about my own conduct towards another person.]

While watching a film of an experimental operation on a cat's  
brain in which the cat had metal pieces protruding from its eyes,  
mouth etc. to keep the head stable while being cut open.

A few weeks back I had a very important seminar and I had  
circulated my papers to all the panel members.  A day before the  
seminar I realized that I had inadvertantly burdened certain        
derivations and I had failed to correct it.  I feared that this     
would reflect very badly on my performance.  Fortunately none of   
the panel members detected it and I felt relieved.

The curriculum of the year !   The English course was very heavy.  
 I had not prepared and the teacher asked several questions  
during class.  The students were not ready to answer the  
questions and the teacher was frustated.

A person that eat half of a cockroach in a cake without knowing  
it.

The repression of rioting and non-rioting "Blacks" in South  
Africa by the police of that "Democracy".

That I didn't want my friend to leave on holiday for 10 days  
because I thought I would miss him. I was constantly trying to  
persuade him.

I saw a magazine with photographs of dead and maimed people whose  
limbs were separated from their body like a head on one side and  
the leg on the other.

One day I was angry with my friend who went into my drawer and  
took a piece of paper on which I wanted to write a letter and  
used it for her business without my knowledge.

When my father failed to send me transport money after the  
closure of the school.

I wrote an assignment and was given less marks than a friend with  
whom I had previously discussed the assignment.

I hate hypocrisy. My friend (girl) tried to intrude into my  
affairs with my future husband. After that she behaved as if  
nothing had happened.
My fiancT left me for my best friend.

A kitten had wandered into our office, and I was told to take it  
back across the street. When I crossed back, the kitten followed  
me and was run over and killed by a car.
Finally being asked by someone to a banquet.

When I didn't study for tests in High School. In particular   
remember a physics test. I didn't study because my friends talked  
me out of it and we did something else boring. I felt so helpless  
just being there - then guilt set in because I was very close to  
getting an A in the class.

I was very sad when I could not take the M.A (I) exams due to  
illness, and a relative of mine disheartened me about it.
Not collecting letters for my friend al I promised.
When I see dead dogs on the road.

A month ago I turned in an English paper in late after I had  
already had a previous paper late and promised not to do it  
again.

When someone I was close to became a paranoid schizophrenic and I  
was unable to see this person because of the situation.

I had been telling lies and people discovered instantly that I  
was telling lies. I felt very shameful and I felt like  
disappearing from people.

My boyfriend's mother, whom I had not met earlier, made an  
unexpected visit.  I was lying lazily on the bed, reading a  
newspaper and my boyfriend was studying.

When males in my family try to assign house duties exclusively  
with referance to sex.

When someone pointed out that I was proud, yet I didn't dress up  
properly. This was when I and my friend went for a dnce one  
Saturday.

On December the 28th I was filled with Joy when I was told by my  
bosses that I had been selected to attend a course at the  
Lilongwe School for Health Scienced in Lilongwe.

The last time I was face to face with with the monstrous dog  
which lives in my street.

When my father told me that I should help my mother more often,  
because she was so busy. And I realized that he was right.
[ When I was treated unfairly, regardless of my motives or deeds.]
When I was insulted by a man.

Fear overwhelmed me when right against the car I was in I saw  
another one, as if out of control of the driver.
Fight with my mate after a quarrel.
When someone is accused or punished instead of me.

I saw a bag on the street and just then a stranger passed by.  I  
picked up the bag immediately and gave it to the stranger as I  
thought that it belonged to him.  But it was not his bag and I  
felt ashamed.

When I hadn't studied for an exam, so I pretended to be sick so I  
wouldn't have to go to school. I lied to my mother - she realized  
I had been lying when she got home from work and found that I had  
been over to a friend's place.

Boyfriend doing cleaning in situation where it was my job to do  
it. Later snapped at him over trivial thing. He looked downcast.  
I felt guilty - "he's just done all that work for me".
Once I lied to my parents and this made me feel very guilty.

I was once raped (one year ago) by a man who was a lot older than  
me and whom I just met. Maybe it wasn't rape but the man wanted  
more than I wanted to give him since there were other people in  
vicinity.

We were in a disco and the evening was not at all pleasant.   
Despite my not knowing why, I was angry with my companion.  I let  
him feel my bad humour as I cannot hide my feelings.

Being with a close friend, in the city, who was involved at the  
present point in time in outrageous activity.
A friend's brother died.

When I learnt that my offer to study at the university had been  
withdrawn  and so I would not get hostel accomodation at UNZA,  
even though I registered as a student later.

When my niece was 3 years old she was in the living room while we  
were fixing the table for a birthday party and, as every child,  
she couldn't stay calm. She burst a balloon. When I told her to  
be quiet her father pinched her. I believe if I hadn't said anything  
this wouldn't have happened.

I made an unkind remark about the ethnicity of some friends  
without realizing it.
Finding out that a boy I do not like is in love with me.
Often a dog which is treated very badly by his owner comes to us.

When I have to go in for an exam and the examinor is a person  
with a whimsical character and unsteady requirements.

[ When I break someone's things out of carelessness, or do something   
to make others feel unhappy  or hurt the self-esteem / self-confidence   
of others, especially if they happen to be friends or family members.]

In the bus I was sitting next to a colleage who was drunk and  
behaved in keeping with his state.

A very close friend of mine was refused entrance to the medical  
school.  Her grades were very good and she should not have been  
left out.  Biased judgment !
When I saw a spider.

They asked me to throw the rubbish into a dustbin which had some  
awful liquid accumulated at the bottom.

When I was told that a boy did not want to be my friend without  
any apparent reason.

I was all of the sudden sad when I heard that my cousin who  
usually paid school fees had passed away after a very short  
illness.
When my father was ill and was waiting for the results of his tests.

When two female classmates and I were having lunch, we chatted and   
cracked jokes, I was very happy.  However, I felt that I may have   
said something inappropriate which might cause them to have a bad   
impression of me.
The death of my grandfather.

I am ashamed at myself sometimes when I am working with  
handicapped people and don't wish to be seen in public with them.
When I failed to answer a simple question.

I omitted to do a favor to a friend, while he was very much in  
need for help.

I was doing an experiment and was not getting the appropriate  
result despite the fact that I had repeated the procedure 4-5  
times.  Then finally I got it right by a stroke of luck.

It happened that one of my best friends just took my shirt  
without my knowledge, I hadn't put it on for many days and I was  
short of clothes.

When I saw parents punishing their little child for something he  
had not done.  In my opinion, even if he had done it he should  
not have been punished for it.

When I was young I saw a horror film.  Then when I went to sleep,  
the film came back too my mind and the characters frighteneed my  
imagination.
The day I finished my military service.

When I got the feeling that I had to do all the housekeeping  
while my boyfriend didn't do anything. This happened in a period  
of exams when I had to study very hard.

This monday I took a Math 1BS test and flunked for the second  
time.

My cat died from an illness.  It had been with us for 7 years.   
It was a lovely cat.  It had been ill for one or two weeks and  
the veterinary surgeon had told us that it was dying.
The loss of a close relative who was ill with cancer.

When I went to a job interview, I met a person who was very nice,  
and his attitude made me glad.

Once I spoke without thinking very much - it was quite a  
nonsense.

When I lost my father on the 25th of September,1970.  He died of  
a sore on the leg.

Family discord and uneasiness due to something I did not  
communicate on time.
Finding out that I can go to your English lectures.

When I finished a relation after four years, leading to much  
sorrow for the other one and myself ("although it was the best  
solution").
Bulgaria won a football match against France.

I was at school whhen I received a letter from the dean of my  
school congratulating me for my performance at the previous  
year's exam.

When I was driving my car, I wanted to pick something from the  
floor of the car and drove into the guide-rail. I thought that I  
should not have done that and felt guilty.
When our dog died.
Korean judges cheating.

On boat trip - saw mother giving young child (aprox 6-7 years)  
cigarettes.

When I heard that I had been selected fot the first year at the  
university of Zambia.  This was after my form five at Chikola  
secondary school.

At the end of my holiday job I got less money than was due to me  
and nobody mentioned anything about that.
When I met my new girlfriend with another man in the street.

When I went out with my dog in a forest late at night when we  
were on a camping.

I felt glad when I took the rather difficult organic chemistry  
examination.

My grandfather had lung-cancer and was being nursed at  
home.  I felt fear when I was alone with him and he almost choked  
on mucus secretions.

A friend (female) and I were on holiday on Great Barrier Island  
by ourselves. One night we were nearly raped by about 20 locals -  
they came to our bach and tried to break the doors down. All of  
them were stoned or drunk and we hid under the bunks and were  
totally terrified. Eventually these guys gave up and went looking  
for us on the beach. We escaped and slept in the bush for 2  
nights.

I had never made a malicious joke in front of my boyfriend. Last  
week I did it I was funny, he loved it, and I died of shame.

This happened when I went to visit my friend in Chelston and  
found him screwing my girlfriend.

I felt guilt towards my mother when I went to live on rooms in  
Nijmegen where I study.

A situation of overt unfairness, manipulation of people and its  
consequences.

When I saw a picture, in the Gothenburg Post, of a totally  
demolished car with two fatally injured passengers.  The car was  
so badly damaged that they couldn't get the bodies out at the  
scene of the accident.

When I noticed that my parents were not in such a prosperity as  
most people in my surroundings.

When I blamed my failure to the bias and favouritism in the         
marking system, in fact I had not worked hard enough.

When my boyfriend was away, I flirted with his best friend; I  
felt guilty the next day.

I made a long-distance call to people rather close to me and I  
thought about the sad incident that had happened to them in the  
near past; I knew that they were thinking about it too when I made  
the call.

When I was a child, my uncle came to see us. I spit at him and  
ran out - I do not know the reason for that. My father came after  
me and insisted on my apologizing.
With an alcoholic.
Deceived by other people and ran into trouble.
Friend's fiancT left her for me.
Staying alone in the biology building after the dark.
My sister gave birth to twins, healthy ones.

When I heard about the death of somebody I liked very much and I  
was not present either to see the person or to try to share my  
emotions with other friends.

At about midnight I had to go by bike through Graz alone. On the  
whole it was a distance of several kilometers. A car followed me  
through the streets. Only when I went into a one-way street the  
car disappeared. The rest of my way home I was very afraid.

A terrible cloud-burst started when we were camping in a tent on  
a great bald field.
When my grandmother died.

I stayed at home for a period because I felt depressive and I  
neglected my study when people adked me, I told them that I had  
freeterm and studied hard. I felt ashamed for my behavior and  
lies.

After a footballmatch I went home by car, a friend drove. I did  
not realize that he was drunk until we were in the car. He was  
madly racing. Several times we were in dangerous situations and I  
told him to be cautious, but he did not care.

My father had bought too many goods for his shop, there was not  
enough space to store them.

A friend catched me while masturbating. I am not fully sure  
whether she saw it or not.

When my friend did not pass the high school graduation  
examinations.

The day the results of the Chinese university was announced I  
should have been very happy; however my grandmother, because of   
her prejudice and misunderstanding, started a  quarrel with my  
mother.  She expected me to take her side and she deliberately  
talked of my mother's wrong doings.  I was very angry because -  
one my grandmother was not being reasonable and two because it  
should have been a happy day and three we had moved into a new  
house that day.
I feel ashamed when I act dishonestly toward somebody.

Cleaning the bathroom of my apt. and realizing my roommate who  
had lived there all summer by himself had never cleaned the  
place.

I could not take care of my mother when she was admitted to a hospital   
for surgery, I continued my studies as I could not get leave.

When I arrived home late at night.  I know that my mother gets  
worried and this made me feel angry.

When my aunt told me angrily that I was a good-for-nothing and  
she was fed up with my behaviour.

A certain boy came into my room and started telling me that I was  
not pretty, that I had no manners and that I should learn some.   
I had just come to campus and he was in fourth year.

Since I've been here I haven't written to any of my relatives. I got  
a letter from my mom telling me how upset my grandparents are  
from not hearing from me.

My friend was pregnant, but lost her child during the second  
month. I went to see her at hospital - she was crying. I felt  
very sorry for her.

Waiting for my girlfriend to come from her apt. to mine. She was  
very late and I thought something awful had happened.

My boss on the job failed to keep his promise about something he  
knew was extremely important to me.

When my friend told me that he would come and meet me in a  
moment.
When my father died.

Was picking up my father from work and on passing through the  
Valley watched three prostitutes walk up and down waiting for  
someone to pick them up. Clothing was disgusting.

One night I could not practise my violin as my family was  
watching T.V with the lights off, so I wanted to listen to some  
tapes.  It was dark so I asked my brother to bring me a torch,  
however he scolded me.  I was so angry that I slammed my violin  
on the floor.

During my high school time I succeeded to play a concert of  
Mozart on the piano when I gave my first performance I succeeded  
to play it very well.

I had a class-mate who was rather stupid.  I did not like him  
but I respected him.  When he tried to talk to someone, they  
would not listen to him and I could not bear seeing this.

It was the time when everybody spoke about and discussed  
Hainburg. I was also asked for my opinion. I was ashamed because  
I had no firm view of the whole thing and therefor was not able  
to join the conversation.
When I quarelled with my parents.
Death of a close friend.
When I got my drivers licence.
When my grandfather died.

When I stated sharply something I was not very sure of and a few  
days later I was shown to be wrong.
When I had a good result in the certificate examination.

I felt very happy when I heard I had passed the examination to  
move up to the second year course.
When my mother was robbed in a shop.

When present boyfriend's mother approached my parents and self -  
to leave her son alone - as she did not want me for a future  
daughter-in-law.

Once I was not able to give a relative, who was in a critical  
period, a helping hand.  Whenever I think about it I feel guilty   
for letting down the person who trusted me to give him a helping  
hand.

When I was admitted to a Language school. On the day when I was  
informed by a message and my parents congratulated me.

I felt guilty last year during the winter term exams. A colleague  
of mine asked me to give him my lecture notes (I had very good  
notes and I had passed my exam in advance) but I still don't know  
why I didn't give them to him. That colleague failed and he was  
on the verge of not passing it at the supplementary examinations.

A letter from my boyfriend began in such a way that I thought he  
was going to end our relationship. I was afraid of reading the  
rest.

I was skiing alone and the mountain became covered with mist and  
I thought I was lost and was going to panic.

I was walking alone in the street late at night (2.30 am). It was  
very quiet. Then a man approached me and said "Hello".

After one year of searching, my friend and I have found a flat we  
are able to pay for.

The girl with whom I was going around had been forbidden to be  
alone with me in the house.  We paid no attention to this  
prohibition but one day her parents appeared and I jumped out of  
the window.  They saw me.

When my sister died, she was only sixteen when she was put to  
rest.
When I received my promotion letter.
[ After an examine I had been satisfied with.]

I felt sad when I heard that my girlfriend was double-crossing me  
with the boy who is my best friend.

When I was about seven or eight I was caught having stolen a  
doll's dress from my next-door neighbour.
Some foreign students playing loud music late at night.

When my uncle died I saw a funeral for the first time. All people  
stood around the open grave and cried.
Swearing in public.

I was supposed to have done some things for my mother, but just  
plain didn't get around to it.

My mother and my sister carried on picking at me all day long for  
no reason at all and I ended up getting angry.
Suddenly met someone in the biology building at night.
Negative statement concerning me of a friend before strangers.

When I stand at the bus stop for one hour waiting for the bus to  
arrive.

While quarelling with a fellow worker of mine, I was vehement and  
irritated and I told him what I thought of him in plain language.   
I was ashamed of myself when I met him the next day.
Anger towards my lover for being late.
Finding a hair in the soup.

When I failed an exam for which I knew that I had not studied  
hard enough.
Guy I cared for went back to Canada to live.

When I found one of my new pullovers wrinkled inside the  
wardrobe.  My brother had done it.
Talking to my close friend.
When a dog is left whining outside a shop.

Football was a very big deal at my high school, so I was joyous  
when my school's team won the conference championship last year.
Spit and vomit.
Slept with someone close to my girlfriend and myself.

I imagined I heard footsteps up the hall while sleeping in bed  
one night by myself in the house.

While playing indoor-hockey, there always is an older man who  
frequently and intentionally plays the ball out of the field. In  
my opinion this is very childish, because we play for fun only.

One day I shouted at my brother who didn't do any wrong to me  
only that I had a disappointment from a friend and projected it  
on to him. He cried and I felt guilty after sometime.

During the Christmas holidays, I went to see my parents and  
stayed with them for two weeks. After two or three days, we had  
the same conflicts we had had ten years before when I had lived  
with them. They were glad when I left.
Every time I do not write something well in English.

When a person saw that I was accused of something I had not done  
and did not do anything to defend me.

I was riding with a friend in his car. At a speed of 120 km/h on  
the snow-covered motorway I would have liked to get out.

When I stepped on a snake at home, it was dark but there was  
moonlight.

When I went to a halloween party and had to walk through a shopping  
center dressed like a witch.
I said nasty things which I did not mean to a friend.

When I came back to my hostel, my bed was full of newspapers and  
dirty clothes.  My room-mate asked me to wash the clothes for him  
as he had no time (this was his responsibility).  The food we  
shared had been eaten up by him (I ate little).

I was with a group of people and everybody told me to do or say  
something.  It was a confusing, strong and traumatic situation  
for me.

One day I did not feel very well and I wanted to talk to  
somebody. A friend invited me for dinner and I was very glad.

I complained about a colleague's behaviour as she goes back on  
her word, is often absent and is irresponsible.  I found out that  
she was an alcoholic and was trying to fight againt her  
addiction.

At church camp when I accepted Christ into my life and so did my  
friend.

The fear about my future : work, making ends meet and health.  
Coping.

One evening, I was with a group of friends having a talk.  There  
was a very trustful and joyful atmosphere.

I went for a walk on the beach with a friend whom I had not seen  
for many months.  The weather was very pleasant, we had some  
ice-cream and lots of fun on the beach.

During an informal discussion I contributed a lot even though I  
had not spent much time studying.  Whenever someone said that  
someone was not paying attention, or that he had too many other  
things to do, or that the persoon was not trying his best, I  
would feel ashamed.

A man kept a seat taken by putting his coat on it after a while  
the chair was still empty, I asked him if I could use the chair,  
he didn't agree for the chair was for his coat.
Lost a friend.
Watching the Asian Olympic game (China winning).

When I met a good friend after a long time. We had had a quarrel  
but after two weeks I was really glad to see him again.
When I saw the pictures of the draught in Etiopia.
When my father revealed inconsistent morals.

My dog, whom I had had for eleven years, died. I watched his  
soporification.

A girl, who is a friend of mine was having an affair with a boy  
who is also a friend of mine.  I got to know that this girl was  
also seeing another guy.  Later on, she just broke off with this friend  
of mine without giving any explanations.  This made him sad and  
depressed, and I felt disgust for this girl.

One day I was supposed to go to a movie with my boyfriend. In the  
morning I went to see my Auntie and I didn't come back up to  
evening.
Not doing well in the examn.

Equivocal situation when filling a security questionnaire on  
entering a government building with several people there.

Found out that my grandmother might have been misdiagnosed as a  
psychiatric patient because the doctor did not know about  
neurologism.

My son was registered to get admission in grade one of the          
primary school.  The chances of him getting a place there was 1/10.   
Two weeks later I was informed that he had been enrolled.
Our neighbour came and gossiped, about others, with my parents.

A friend of mine ridiculed me, telling me that I would never  
accomplish anything. I felt that he had interfered with my life.

I had to leave my girlfriend for 4 weeks because of my studies.  
This happens frequently. The last 24 hours before my departure  
are always very depressing.

When my friend ended up pregnant by a gentleman whom I considered  
to be good and faithful but he ended up neglecting her and not  
bothering about her.

If they force me to eat something I don't like. For example, my  
parents always twaddle and whine, when I don't eat all the food.

I had planned to study for my mid-term exams on a certain day and   
my room-mate called me to ask me to go out for a stroll.  I tried  
to make an excuse so as not to go out but she refused to listen  
to me and insisted that I go out with her.  I find it unnecessary   
to talk to her anymore.
When I worked at the life-saving sevice and saw the first exitus.
When I wanted to kiss a friend and didn't succeed, I felt shame.

When a boy tried to fool me so he would be OK trying to show me  
that he is a gook boy.

When I saw hundreds of snakes twisting over one another in a  
movie.

When I walk through streets late at night. This is because I and  
my friends were attacked one night without any reason for it.

When I realized that I avoided two good friends with whom I  
always shared toys and sorrows. I made up idle stories to avoid  
telling them what happened to me.

When I spoke to my daughter and wished her luck for the  
examinations she was about to take.

When realizing that my girlfriend and myself in fact had started  
the process of breaking up.

I had a very good friend in secondary school.  The year after our  
graduation I prepared to celebrate her birthday and I called off  
all my appointments.  I got together the other friends and we  
were ready to give the entire day to her.  However this friend  
disappeared on her birthday.  When I phoned another friend I  
didcovered thay she was busy, I did not call her anymore.

Disappointed love. The girl made an end to our relationship while  
I thought she was in love with me.

In the last year of the high school we had a huge fight between  
my group and the graduation commission (two students of my  
classroom) because they accused us unjustly of a gossip about  
them.

Guilt at often being unable to visit a close relative in hospital  
after her death I felt very guilty and wished I had done more.
When I can see my parents because now I am far from them.

Once I quarrelled with my sister and after this I deliberately  
messed up her belongings.
When I passed standard 8 exams I jumped, rolled over the ground.

One evening when my sisters, brothers and I were watching T.V my  
kid brother took a big mirror and reflected light on the french  
windows.  I thought that these lights that we could see were  
coming from torches annd that it meant that there were thieves  
outside.

When I asked my classmate to teach me to do my homework, he asked  
me to study by myself first but I did not do it.  When he asked me  
 if I had studied, I felt very ashamed.
Not acting on my promise.

When Wayne and Sue (close friends) were announced our guardians  
at ther wedding.

In a dark street at 4 o'clock in the night and there was  
complete silence.

I had shouted at my younger brother and he was always afraid when  
I called out loudly.

I borrowed money from a friend and did not pay back the debt when  
I said I would.

One day I went to see a movie without my parents permission.  It  
was an adult movie and I was scared that my parents would not  
allow me to see the movie.  However after coming home I felt very  
guilty at what I had done.
Whenever I see a spider or a snake I feel disgusted.
When someone tried to bewitch me and my friends at night.

Joy of giving birth, and of sharing that joy with my husband.  
Moments of complete happiness and feelings of so much love.

After our sad first of May party, I felt ashamed because the  
friends who had been invited had to suffer.  We, the organizers  
of the party, did not drive the intruders away.

Arriving in New Zealand as a teenager - first overseas trip -  
something "exhilarating" about the change of scenery etc.

I was disgusted with my brother's behaviour when he kept throwing  
things away because of his anger, after mum had shouted at him.

The day that the results of the college entrance examinations for  
the S. Paulo University were published and I didn't find my name  
on the list. Entering this University was my greatest wish, and   
the fact of not having succeded caused a great frustration, and  
not only sadness.

I felt fear when I fell down and broke my leg into pieces and I  
could not feel it at all.

I feared that I would have to describe my sexual life to an  
older, strange woman.
A friend who was 22 years old died.
When I had an argument with a friend.
My cat died painfully and slowly.

My girlfriend was away visiting another city and I brought  
another girl home. Next morning when I started getting sober I  
felt quite ashamed of myself.

A customer at the shop where I worked came in and asked if the  
goods that he had ordered had arrived.  I had totally  
forgotten about this order and I tried to offer weak excuses.

I feel this feeling when I am to fill in a questionnaire or a  
form.

I had been drinking with a pal and I later (1 o' clock) had a date   
with my fiancee.  We were going to a Spanish lesson and I was  
afraid that she would smell that I had been drinking.
To see damaged lettuce (with worms) in the icebox.

Once in my homes yard, I was plaing football with my cousin and  
in a certain quick the ball went on uncontrolled putting down a  
bird-cage, killing it.
My uncle died in the Vietnam War.

I should have given a test lesson to get a job. I had no courage.  
I didn't make the test.
Letting Jesus take control of my emotions i.e., ill feeling.
Not helping other people to do their homework.
When I was accepted at UNZA.

My father gave me money for school fees and I didn't pay school  
fees instead I spent it on beer and did not tell him about this.

I was going to go on a vacation to Texas this summer but was  
unable to go because of registration.

I bought an aquarium which made me much pleasure. I was watching  
the fish when my father came in and asked me how much I had payed  
for it. He said he would not pay for the current that it would  
require.

At the age of 12 years I always had to take care of my little  
brother and sister I never could sleep then. I always imagined  
creepy men sneaking into our house.
Insulted by classmate in public.
Forced to fill in a questionnaire.
When I got my results ( I had made it to the second year ).
Telling friends about your nickname.

While skiing in Squaw Valley, I was riding up a chair lift and  
right when the chair was above a sheer cliff of rocks, the chair  
lift stopped and all the chairs sagged and everything seemed to  
creak loudly.

During the Chinese lessons a student often showed off. Moreover  
he misbehaved and dressed very badly.  So disgusting !

I was ashamed when my friend and I were cross with each other  
till we apologized to each other.

As we were going to Area 10 a dog chased me. I was afraid it  
might bite me.

A very close friend of mine died. I read it in the newspaper. I  
didn't know what to do and thought about it the whole day.
My partner left me after we had been together for a long time.

I was on a class excursion, by boat to Stockholm.  At night my  
class mates prepared to clebrate their motive in life which was  
"life is merriment".  I felt depressed about the way they sought  
happiness.
A relative, whom I like very much, left for the United States.
After a big fight with my parents.

Did well in an examn just before my father's birthday: the best  
present I can give to my father.
Never really had the experience just yet - N/A.
When I and the boy next door set fire to a house by accident.
Car accident, hurt three of my closest family.
When I was locked out of my room by my room-mate's friend.
Leaving high school.

It was when a friend took me to a place and gave me as a gift my  
astrologycal map with the explanations of a psychologist.

[ During my childhood when I could not get what I wanted from my  
brother/sister and parents.]
When I got the loan for my studies.

When I think that I will probably never have a genuine contact  
with my parents.
When my mother had a nervous illness.

After I had had a disappointment in my private life, my friend,  
who studies in Vienna, came to see me spontaneously.

My father suddenly fell ill. He stayed for 3 months in the  
hospital: the last month on intensive care of the Academic  
Hospital, then he died.
When a little brother of mine damaged a cassette.

I "picked up" a girl and I thought that I had misused my  
position and authority over her as there did not seem to be any  
realistic possibility of continuing the relationship.
Walking in the dark and thinking about ghost stories.

Went to a lecture about Chinese history and hear about the Opium  
War.

I was looking for an object when I came across a rotten corpse of  
a rat.
Reading a horror story alone.
I was scared in the dark when I was a little boy.
Insulted by somebody.

When I decided not to out any longer with a girl whom I liked  
quite a lot.  This made me feel low for a some time.

I felt guilty about going out when I should have been studying  
for a presentation I had to give on Wednesday the next week.

I did a solo flight from Ardmore to Kaikohe before I got my pilot  
licence. I can remember it was gorgeous day and I was on a  
natural high, cruising up the coast with my maps and compasses  
and gear. Other pilots had seen me off and wished me good luck  
and it was a real adventure.

I was at a children's camp abroad. The people (the leaders, my  
coevals) were very king to us. One night we smeared our foreign  
friends with tooth-paste while they were sleeping and then we  
roused the whole camp by our shouts. Later I was so sorry. I  
didn't utter a word for two days, then I went to apologize.

My brother came to see me and found me with a boy friend.  When  
my boyfriend greeted him, he did not answer and instead started  
shouting at me and scolding me in the prescence of my boyfriend.
I felt sad and depressed when I heard that our cat had died.

When I meet old past pupils of mine - and find they are all doing  
well - I feel joy. Yesterday I met a young woman (20 yrs) I'd  
taught her at 6 yrs, then at 12 yrs and hadn't seen her for last  
3-4 yrs; she was no longer a waitress but a meter maid for  
Council.

In my 20s - and was going out to dinner to celebrate a friend's  
birthday. Her (older - in 30s) cousin, really wanted me to get  
drunk cos I'd visited their (cousin & wife) place quite a bit,  
but had always been very careful - brought up to believe in  
moderation in drink (but not guilt repression etc). I mixed  
drinking with smoking (which I rarely did) and got drunk and had  
to leave the table to get sick in the loo, and later went home  
and was sick again; have never felt so awful in my life. And I  
didn't want to face or tell my other flatmates, or family.

When my brother was born, everything went all right.  It had been  
very likely that he would have a deficiency (my sister suffers  
from Down's Syndrome) and that my mother would be in danger.
Not getting on with someone of my classmates in high school.

When I was accused by my brother of having stolen a 5 kwatcha  
note from my mother's bag.  I was beaten up for this, the money  
was found later.

One night during dinner my nephew was naughty, so I quarrelled with my   
parents.   I regreted this as my nephew was only two years old and I   
had to tolerate him !  The quarrel made my father think that his children   
may not take care of him in the future (it was a slip of the tongue and   
this made me realize that my father keeps his thoughts to himself).  I was   
still very angry so I dropped my bowl and chopsticks and went to the kitchen   
to drink tea and then ran to the other side of the house.

Someone told me he was chosen for the English lectures because he  
was a good friend of the class leader.

When my mother betrayed me by obtaining money from my husband  
when we were separated - pending divorce.
Thinking about other things in a lecture.
NO RESPONSE.

I received an unexpected B+ on an engineering midterm. I did not  
study nearly as much as I should have and it was a difficult  
test.

During military service a superior reproached me unjustly. This  
led to friction in a lot of situations.

When the guy I was in love with told me that he had met someone  
else and that we would not meet again for a year.  Although we  
did not have a steady relatioship, we were having an affair.
The loss of the woman who loved me most till today.
When my brother died.
When I was going to take the practical exams.

When I met a girl and asked her for a date and she agreed, (I  
thought this girl would never like me), this was an emotion of  
joy.

I'm glad when I have good relations with my colleagues and most  
of all when we are at a party.

When I left a carnaval ball at 4 o'clock a.m. I was alone in a  
foreign city and I had to go back home, when a guy appeared and  
tried to "catch me".

At school, when the only thing people my age could think of was getting  
rolling drunk. They couldn't have a good time without firstly  
getting drunk.

When some friends and I get acquainted a guy during vacations I  
thought he was disgusted and "a friend" of mine for whom I feel a  
little disgust wanted to stay with him.
Can't remember any episode of disgust.
When I got a low grade in an administration course.

I was in a dancing-tavern and the atmosphere was one of waiting  
for the end of the world.  Suddenly people began dancing wildly,  
inspired by the band.  An unbelievable experience : wonderful  
that even Finns sometimes flare up and forget to think "what  
others are thinking of me".  It was delightful to dance to one's  
heart content.
When my sister's boyfriend accused her of having been sleeping around.

News was spread that I had been found doing sexual intercourse  
with a small girl. At first this annoyed me but later on I became  
ashamed because many people seemed to believe it.

I was 4-5 years old when I hid the bicycle keys of a not very  
good friend.  After a few hours I pretended that I had found  
it.
When I was mistreated by my step-mother.
When I was admitted to the University.

I was in "Hainburg" in December and I was angry about the  
politicians and the police.

During a lecture six students (including me) were asked to leave  
the class as we had not prepared for the lesson.  I felt ashamed  
and angry.

One day during our clinical practices, we had a very ill patient.  
Unfortunately the patient passed away. I had seen him dying and  
it was the first experience. During the night I became afraid  
fearing the dead body.

I had arranged with a friend to go with him to Carinthia by car.  
We had arranged a place where to meet. I was a bit late and my  
friend had left already. I had no money to go by train. I nearly  
started to cry because I was so angry - it was very important for  
me to go to Carinthia.

I had studied for almost one week for my physics-examination.  
With difficulty I passed the examn. I was angry about the teacher  
and also about myself because I had not remembered enough during  
the examn and because the time that I spent studying was wasted.

Last night I had a chat with a fellow student.  I had known her  
for about half a year, and for the first time we were speaking  
"the same language"- meaning an inspiring discussion and  
encounter.

I had been watching a triller a dark night in the country and I  
had to go the outside toilet on my own.

At work, when an elderly man complained unjustifiably about me and  
distrusted me.

When my father came into the bathroom and saw me standing there  
naked.

Getting sent on a company expense trip to another state to work  
for a week at that plan.

Someone didn't show up at a meeting in spite of having agreed to  
come.

One of my friends and I had breakfast in a restaurant. It was  
spontaneous and lots of fun.
When I forgot a promise made to a friend of mine.

I think that the only time I really felt shame was when I was  
very young and I had to defecate on the street.  I was very  
worried in case someone should see me.

I was on my way home when suddenly Gule Wamkulu came from the  
bush and blocked the road. I was in fear and didn't know what to  
do.

One of my good friends told people something I had told her  
in confidence about someone else.

I was said to be responsible for my mother getting ill and  
growing thin. I did not realize that it really was my fault until  
several weeks later.
NO RESPONSE.

I felt joy most strongly some years ago, when I took part in a  
NH Competition and I was the first.
Having my luggage checked at Customs.

I was alone in my parents' house, having made plans to spend the  
afternoon with a lover (plans which the lover cancelled),  
watching a movie and considering my life and circumstances -  
pressures of examinations in particular.

When I had not done well in Geography at my MCE I was expected to  
get more than I did.

The day I decided to get out of my house I saw in my brother's  
eyes that they blamed me for the situaiton.

I most joyous moment was the day I got my marks.  I was very  
happy when I came to know about my marks at the M.Sc (part I)  
examination where I got 71.5%.  This was the highest marks I have  
ever scored in my life.
I was late meeting someone for an appointment.

My lovely girlfriend double-crossed me and so that I found her  
chatting with another guy.
A dark night when I had to go to the outdoor lavatory.

I found a problem in homework which would not get solved although  
I tried my best.

When I heard about the advances an acquaintance of mine had made  
to my friends, who did not approve of them.
I was bitten by a dog.

I beat my young sister because she refused to wash plates. She  
started crying and I felt sorry and guilty for what I did.
Acting in a play at the orientation camp made me feel timid.

When I part with my friends I feel always sad for some time. I  
can't remember a concrete example now. For example I have just  
parted with a friend of mine and I am feeling sad.

My father had a complicated operation. A long time before and  
also a long time after that, we did not know how he would get  
over it. During all that time I felt very sad.
I was nearly knocked down while I was cycling.

Iqam chosen for your lecture and my best friend is not. Now he is  
angry with me and I cannot help him.
Car accident in the middle of the night.

This happened when I was selected to go to Secondary school to  
start Form I in October 1980.

I got a very nasty electrical shock when I was tampering with  
some electrical applainces.

My friend promised to take me out for a movie but he didn't turn  
up.

When I get something that seemed very hard like getting a job, a  
boyfriend, etc. A specific sutuations, was when I started to date  
a boy whom I liked for a long time.

When my relatives troubled me so that I would help them  
financially.

A person (a male) told me that he liked me.  He has a problem, he  
is a homosexual.

When I just took a shower with a girl down the hall. I felt that  
I had let my devotion to God go out the window. Although nothig  
happened I felt ashamed.

The end of a relationship (after 4 years) by doing this I hurt  
the other person very much.

Had started a relationship and did nothing to keep it up, partly  
the use of another person.

I stayed at the Coast for a weekend with friends. My brother came  
to drive me home, but was rude, and in a hurry to rejoin his  
friends. I was embarrassed because the family involved was  
extremely nice, and hospitable to him.

When my husband and I spent a night by ourselves in a house which  
was in an area on the outskirts of a large town with which we were   
not familiar.  We  heard strange noises outside the house and the   
house had glass walls so the whole thing was even more  
frightening.

Finding out in your lecture that a doctor can make misdiagnoses  
because of ignorance in neuropsychology.

When my friend got very low marks in field work even though he  
had worked throughout the year, I had this feeling.

When after an overwhelming anxiety and enquiry, I understood  
something about why I exist and what my task in life is.

I felt happy when I learnt that I had qualified for the grade  
eight.
